metadata.dcterms:title: Replication Data for: Bumble bees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) respond to moth (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae) pheromone components, leading to bee bycatch in monitoring traps targeting moth pests
metadata.dcterms:creator: Grocock, Nicholas
Batallas, Ronald
McNamara, Emily
Sturm, Ashton
Manson, Jessamyn
Evenden, Maya
metadata.dcterms:description: Data associated with a study investigating the capture of wild bees in moth pheromone-baited traps in agricultural settings in Alberta, Canada. Files contain raw data on records for all captured bee specimens as well as electroantennogram (EAG) responses.
metadata.dcterms:subject: Agricultural Sciences
Bombus
Pollinator
Bycatch
Non-target
Pheromone
Semiochemical
metadata.dcterms:isReferencedBy: Grocock N, Batallas R, McNamara E, Sturm A, Manson J, Evenden M. 2020. Bumble bees (Hymenoptera: Apidae) respond to moth (Lepidoptera: Noctuidae) pheromone components, leading to bee bycatch in monitoring traps targeting moth pests. Frontiers in Ecology and Evolution.
